alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 8:16AM CST until March 04 at 12:40PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Alabama, including the following counties, Colbert and Lauderdale. * WHEN...Until 930 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 815 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in parts of northern Colbert County and across Lauderdale County. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible across Lauderdale and Colbert Counties. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Florence, Muscle Shoals, Sheffield, Tuscumbia, Rogersville, Killen, Cherokee, Lexington, St. Florian, Underwood- Petersville, Anderson, Waterloo, Zip City, Oakland, Threet, Northwest Alabama Regional Airport, Pride Landing, Ford City, Green Hill and Barton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
